title: Left-Leaning Victorian Script...
content:
Hey everyone! I know this is almost certainly hand-drawn lettering, but if anyone knows of a font version of this or has any other information, I would be extremely grateful!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080109160714im_/http:/typophile.com/files/identifont_4949.gif)

It’s a left-leaning modern script from the cover of an old theater playbill from the 1930s.

Thanks for looking, and have a beautiful day.

Howard

 [‹ 49 lead letter prints added to "Schriftensammlung"](http://web.archive.org/web/20080109160714/http:/typophile.com/node/40585 "Go to previous forum topic") [General Type ID Terminology? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080109160714/http:/typophile.com/node/40601 "Go to next forum topic")
author: nevadicus

comments.content: I can think of similarly flavored scripts that lean right ( [Radio](http://web.archive.org/web/20080109160714/http:/vllg.com/Thirstype/Radio/mudTyper+Weights/)) and don’t lean at all ( [Coquette](http://web.archive.org/web/20080109160714/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/mark_simonson/coquette/)) but not left.

Something about [Mrs. Von Eckley](http://web.archive.org/web/20080109160714/http:/sudtipos.com/fonts/60) reminds me of this, although it’s not quite as regular as your sample.

- Lex

Thanks for your help! I think Radio might be the closest-looking one for my purposes. I appreciate the fast responses!  
Best,  
Howard
